website_summaries.verdict: A reliable modem that offers simple connectivity and speeds that meet the needs of most users.
pros: The plug-and-play simplicity of Linksys modems is a primary benefit, and that is true of this model as well
Offers a dependable connection once it's up and running
The 686 Mbps download speed is enough to manage even the top-tier cable ISP packages
Works well for average-sized families with routine internet habits
cons: This modem needs room to breathe to handle its download speeds, and may tend to run hot if tucked away in small spaces

customer_reviews.title: Great Modem Comcast/Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Great modem. I picked it up on a lightning deal. After reading reviews I was a little hesitant. However I have had no overheating issues and no connectivity issues. When running speed tests I am getting getting the speeds that I'm paying for. My service provider is Comcast/ Xfinity. Please note that when dealing with Comcast you may have to go to tier 2 tech support to get it connected because they hate when you use your own equipment as they lose the monthly equipment lease fee. They will claim that your modem is broken, do not listen to them demand to speak with tier 2 tech support.
customer_reviews.author: JLX

customer_reviews.title: Intel Puma 6 chipset included = Issues with online gaming and streaming media
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this product like the plague. It houses the Intel Puma 6 Chipset, which Intel has already admitted there was a flaw with. Long story short, intermittent processes within the modem choke the CPU which causes packet loss. Thus leading to issues with online gaming and streaming. Don't believe any nonsense about a provider being able to "fix" the problem. Modem's operate with an SDK(systems development kit). The profile your ISP sends to it, communicates with the SDK, it doesn't change it. Stick with your old modem or buy one that doesn't have this chipset.
customer_reviews.author: The_guy_who_knows_things

customer_reviews.title: ~$50 for ~40 days of service is unwise.
customer_reviews.text: Modem looked great with its docsis 3.0, intel chipset, xfinity-approved branding. My setup is a xfinity connection at the lowest speed-tier, a ubiquiti air-router, and this cable modem. After a month (less than a week ago), my internet went out, and I was confident that the fault lay in xfinity's service, because my equipment is bespoke and amazon. However, a technician plugged in his ARRIS cable-modem behemoth and I then knew that the fault lay in my brand-new linksys cm3008. Sadly, my ownership has crossed the 30-day Amazon return-window by 9 days. Looks like this piece of technology is prematurely landfill-bound.
customer_reviews.author: Tara C

customer_reviews.title: Much better than renting your modem from the Internet provider.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Remember that these are not plug-n-play, you will have to call your Internet provider so they can activate the unit on their end. The modem is compact and I have had no issues with it thus far. Much better option than paying to rent a modem from Comcast (this modem has the same speed capability as the Comcast modems).
customer_reviews.author: KLS Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Works with Spectrum Cable until they seem to go out....
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of technical information about how well this modem works with Spectrum over my last modem, but it does work better. I still have issues with Spectrum and the internet suddenly going out and in at night, but I don't think the modem is at issue. I can recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Charles In Sumter

customer_reviews.title: this is great modem. I changed from DSL service to higher ...
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes, this is great modem. I changed from DSL service to higher speed cable, and needed a modem if I didn't want to pay the $10/monthly fee my ISP charged for 'renting' a modem. It is fully compatible with the service, and provides the main interface between the cable that runs into the house and the router(s) I have installed in the house to provide wired/wireless coverage throughout. Future higher speeds might not be supported by this modem, it doesn't support DOCSIS 3.1 and Gigabit throughputs. But until then, the modem supports the rated speed of my providers service and everything is good!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Seery

customer_reviews.title: Fixed - MAC Address and Serial Number already registered with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Purchased product to cut the cost on a Comcast modem - works great so far. Registered this brand new modem with Comcast, but not after being told the MAC and serial number were already in use. It turns out there is an issue with the Comcast system. The agent entered my MAC and S/N, which immediately registered with Comcast under a placeholder name - When the agent goes to register it under your name it is already in the system appearing to belong to someone else. Explain this and it could help your issue... or someone is still registered with your modem's MAC and S/N. Great modem, great help from Comcast, 30 minute inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Jbogs

customer_reviews.title: Plagued by Intel Puma 6
customer_reviews.text: Plagued by the Intel Puma 6 chipset latency. It seems to get worse as your network demands increase. It constantly drops my connection in online games. I have been on the phone with my ISP for over a week about these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Intel puma 6 chipset: CM3024 is born to be defective
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know how many people can see it. It took me 2.5 years to realize this defective product. Anyone who saw this review, please stay away from CM3024. The intel puma 6 chipset issue is real. For my case: it is working but the internet speed never get to the ISP plan speed. I got 8-10 Mbps test speed for 100 Mbps plan. After upgrading to 600 Mbps plan, things got even worse with slower speed. This is why I realized this issue. Linksys is fully aware of this issue, but they still decided to continue selling this product. I just do what I can to warn people about it.
customer_reviews.author: Roy zeppelin

customer_reviews.title: Slow internet and no Cellspot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem to replace an Arris that Comcast no longer "approves". It would work with my Persomnal Cellspot so I call T-Mobile (who provided the Cellspot) and Comcast. Both said to talk to Linksys, when I called Linksys' customer support the rep clearly had no idea what a Cellspot was. She kept asking how my phone was plugged into the modem! My internet is slower and now I don't have my Cellspot either. I wish I could go back to my old Arris modem. Reviews on the newer Arris modem are pretty bad too so I don't know which modem I will buy next but it will not be Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: mocker82

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Modem, Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use this with Cox Arizona. I'm paying for a 300Mbps plan and with this modem I just tested it and got 329 down and 29 up. So far so good after 3 weeks. I did have to call Cox, but from the time I dialed them until the time it was active was about 15 minutes. No problems there. It doesn't have a phone jack but who cares about that. It's definitely not nearly as warm as the one I'd previously been renting from Cox.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: This modem has given me a lot of grief. ...
customer_reviews.text: This modem has given me a lot of grief. It dies for no reason and has to be constantly reset to reconnect to the internet. I will throw it away because the return period has expired, and I will go back to renting one from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Tiny.  So nice and tiny.  Cable installer exclaimed too.
customer_reviews.text: This modem was perfect for me - time will have to tell if it lives up to my initial reaction. Why'd I get this one other than it was on the approved list for my cable provider? Well, glad you asked. It's tiny compared to the hulking brutes that are most cable modem/routers I saw while shopping around. Its hardly any bigger than the tiny DSL modem I replaced... and that's a good thing, because there's not room for most other cable modem/router devices I saw. Also, I'm inclined to prefer the low voltage input (wall wart) as it reduces bulk in the modem itself.
customer_reviews.author: kbulgrien

customer_reviews.title: If you surf the web and don't want to rent, get this
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandson so he would stop paying rental fees. But what I'm about to write is the truth and nothing but the truth. The day before receiving this modem mine went out. So I could get back up and running........ Yep, that's right I took this one. He never knew I was getting him one anyways. Bad Grandpa. Called the internet carrier and gave them the MAC address and I was back up and surfing again. First place I went was Amazon to get another modem. After all it was one of his Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Modem worked well, but only lasted 1 year. ...
customer_reviews.text: Modem worked well, but only lasted 1 year. Ethernet port failed almost exactly 1 year after installation. It was cheap and comcast/xfinity compatible, but the money I was hoping to save by not renting a modem from comcast/xfinity was minimized by the short lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: Works well, setup was a bit of a nuisance.
customer_reviews.text: We run this and a linksys router, it gave us a little trouble at first until we tightened the coax cable way way in. It will act like it's running but not give you internet unless you do tighten it really well. We are only using internet with it, and it does give us a bit of lag when we have 4 devices on, not splitting our available bandwidth evenly it seems. Overall it is a solid router and a much better option than renting the one from Comcast (you'll save your money spent in 7 months, ) and it gives us less trouble than the ones from Comcast, so I would recommend it keeping in mind the minor issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware : Spectrum Customers
customer_reviews.text: Five stars is for Amazon/reseller return policy. Spectrum advertises this exact model on their compatibility list. That was inaccurate info for our area ... so we had to return it and use the mystery meat that our installer had in his truck.
customer_reviews.author: fd

customer_reviews.title: Solid Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: A nice compliment to the AC5400 router I got as well. Worked without much issue. Biggest hassle was being on hold with TimeWarner tech support and giving them the MAC address for the device and waiting for the activation signal. I achieve speeds I'm paying for more often than not. Solid piece of equipment that is well aerated on the sides so it won't overheat. I was up and running in under 20-25 minutes from open box to connected.
customer_reviews.author: Chris, Earthling

customer_reviews.title: Both the modem and its power-brick are cool to the touch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Linksys CM2034 cable modem, and can report that the product performs well for me. The speeds I am paying for are well below the published nominal specifications for the CM2034, so I cannot report on the top-end performance, but it works very well, and there is absolutely no sign of overheating as reported by some reviewers. Both the modem and its power-brick are cool to the touch. A great product that I can recommend without reservation based on my own actual experience.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Q

customer_reviews.title: Just fine - easy setup on Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Have had in use for about a month now on Xfinity/Comcast and it works just fine. Totally reliable and easy to install with Comcast. I originally purchased the bigger/faster 24x8 version from Costco, but further research determined that I could buy this unit for less than 1/2 the price and it would deliver all the speed possible from my mid-tier Xfinity internet plan, so I returned that one unopened at my local Costco store.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: Sold me a product that was used, claiming it was new. Dont trust linksys. Xfinity refuses to re-use modems, because its a way they can force non tech savy consumers to rent their ungodly overpriced modems.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Wolfgang Dunn

customer_reviews.title: resets 15-20 times a day
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to escape the rental fee from my cable company (spectrum). The modem worked for about a month, then began to reset/re-cycle several times a day. I have a Linksys router and thought they would be a match made in heaven. Well, they have now divorced because I bought a Netgear modem and it has been running fantastic so far with no resets whatsoever. I learned later after some research that my former Linksys modem contains the dreaded puma chipset by intel. So much for true love. I bought the extended warranty for the Linksys , but with the mentioned chipset, I don't believe the problem would be solved. So I write this to warn others.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: No problem with Time Warner Cable (Spectrum)
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly with Time Warner cable (now called Spectrum for some reason). I had to plug this modem to the coax cable and to a computer and then i had to follow the instructions in the registration page (needed the info found on the latest bill). the whole process took at most ten minutes. Saved 10 bucks a month buying this bad boy. If you want wifi you'll need a separate router or you need to get a modem with wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Internet connection solved.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a computer programmer working from home. Was having lots of difficulty keeping my internet connection. Line would drop at least twice a day. Replaced my 4-year-old router with a Linksys WRT1900AC router, but still had problems. Replaced my 4-year-old modem with this Linksys High Speed DOCSIS modem and problem is solved! My assumption is the new router needed a faster modem to keep up. I lose my connection about once every four days, but I can live with that. Great modem at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: stay away
customer_reviews.text: my internet service provider provides me with 150mps download speeds and 6mps upload. this thing only runs 2/3s of the speed.after speaking to them about this topic i was i was hung up on.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Who wants to pay modem rental fees?
customer_reviews.text: The device runs a little hot but no problems so far. The modem pays for itself in six months when you consider you're no longer paying modem rental fees! I'm using this for my Comcast Xfinity 100 Mbps service.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo

customer_reviews.title: Two consecutive failures
customer_reviews.text: After 10 years of reliable service ,Mediacom forced me to retire my original Linksys modem. The first 3024 would not connect out of the box .Returned it for another. The second one lasted 18 days and would not connect after two hours with the Mediacom techs . Went to Walmart and got a top of the line Motorola .this Am. Up and running now . Probably will avoid Linksys in the future .... Jim H
customer_reviews.author: james h.

customer_reviews.title: I received the modem quickly but was also quickly disappointed. The speeds on this modem were 20mbps when ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the modem quickly but was also quickly disappointed. The speeds on this modem were 20mbps when the Comcast modem was giving me 170mpbs. Linksys support is TERRIBLE and was absolutely no help what so ever. I re-activated my Comcast modem and I'm now getting the speeds I'm paying for. I do NOT recommend supporting Linksys products anymore. I will be returning this device and be taking my money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mozzone

customer_reviews.title: It is cheap and "works". We have to unplug ...
customer_reviews.text: It is cheap and "works". We have to unplug and restart it about once a week. Not sure if that is this fault, the router or our service.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to stop paying $10/month to Comcast for hardware rental.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a Linksys AC2600 to replace my Comcast router. My external bandwidth to the internet is unchanged, but my internal network performance and routing functionality is improved. This also saves me $10/month so should pay for itself in 2 years. Seems significantly more reliable than the comcast router - i.e. I have to reboot it significantly less frequently than the Comcast router.
customer_reviews.author: Roland Wooster

customer_reviews.title: ... her and purchased the Linksys modem and couldn't be happier. I thought it was going to be difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been telling me for years to get my own modem and finally I listened to her and purchased the Linksys modem and couldn't be happier. I thought it was going to be difficult to install no problems. So easy 1,2,3 and that's it call your cable company give them the mac number and it's all done. I noticed that my computer and even my TV ran much faster. I wish I would had done this years ago as saving $11.00 or more with taxes on your cable bill is great.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Logsdon

customer_reviews.title: ... start steaming anything have to unplug it let it cool down and restart it to make the modem work ...
customer_reviews.text: Over heats and stops working as soon as we start steaming anything have to unplug it let it cool down and restart it to make the modem work again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R Burdge

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. And is not running hot.
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this modem in order to save some money on my monthly Comcast/Xfinity fees. It turns out my Xfinity Blast Plus service from 4 years ago now offers 200Mbps down instead of 100Mbps. But with the 4 year old Cisco modem I was only pulling about 126Mbps down. I am now getting 230Mbps down. Setting up is simple. I did the activation on line without having to call. Connect cable modem Reboot your router Reboot computer of flush DNS Open a web browser and complete activation process Reboot router again Reboot computer Online. I have been pulling large data files down since installing the modem and it is not even warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless for a home office
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: Despite advertising this as compatible with Comcast, etc., this modem DOES NOT support a phone or fax. There is no jack. Absolutely useless for a home office. Even LINKSYS, on it's own website, advertises this as including "phone cables." It does not. Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Lost Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working well. Setup was quick. ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working well. Setup was quick. It is very small and very hot. Just hope the lifespan isn't impacted by the heat. 10/3 Sadly, the heat does seem to be impacting the operation of the modem. Frequent disconnects. I have to unplug the modem for 30+ minutes to get back online. The coax connector is hot to the touch. Like touching a hot stove burner. I've not yet contacted Linksys, amazon says that I'm past my return period. Probably not the modem to get until the heat issue is resolve by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: It's barely been a month but so far so good; no melting issues as with the lower bandwidth models plus I have the opportunity to move up from my current speed package to the most available for my area...setting it up wasn't as easy as equipment I've had in the past, but this can depend a lot on the tech that answers the phone, and not necessarily inherent to the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Not Sure

customer_reviews.title: Dated Hardware with Possible Buggy Intel Puma Chipset
customer_reviews.text: This is dated hardware, per Spectrum Cable is minimally capable, and is based on the Intel Puma Chipset which has known bugs. My experience was that while the device usually worked OK, from time to time connectivity would drop for up to a minute. Though the occurrence of this issue seemed to be clustered over time, typically several times in an hour and then not again for a day or more, I was not able to reproduce the issue. I did not have the issue after replacing with a 24x8 capable modem that uses the Broadcom chipset (Netgear CM600).
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Woods

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement from cable company modem.
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed, no issues. I dont use it for gaming. I do get average of 184mbs out of my 200mbs service. Worked better after firmware update from cable company.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Gemma

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Modem!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the top speed from my internet provider and I didnt want to do that rent BS so I bought this and I am getting the fastest speed my internet provider offers and it was really easy to set up by just calling your internet provider and giving them the mac address on the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Tim A.

customer_reviews.title: So far this thing has worked well. It does ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this thing has worked well. It does get hot but in my attic where it gets really hot in the summer it seems to have no problems. This may reduce the life of the unit but will see.
customer_reviews.author: Malik

customer_reviews.title: Works well with xfinity
customer_reviews.text: I recently installed this modem with xfinity blast pro and it works really well. Installation was very easy and I get close to 280Mbps download. Unlike what some reviewers had experienced, my modem does not get hot. It is a bit warm, but that's quite normal for such electronic devices.
customer_reviews.author: Babak S.

customer_reviews.title: but so far I'm pretty pleased. I upgraded from a 50MB modem (this ...
customer_reviews.text: I've just had it up and running for 3 days, but so far I'm pretty pleased. I upgraded from a 50MB modem (this one is rated up to 300MB). I only have 100MB internet, but I wanted to be prepared for the future so I got this one and am currently seeing download speeds of 110-120MB. I can't say for certain that it handles up to 300MB but only because I don't have that speed coming through my lines - I have little doubt that it would perform great at that speed as well. Easy hook up, and plug and play as soon as you give your ISP the MAC address on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah White

customer_reviews.title: A solid error-free unit that works 24/7
customer_reviews.text: My previous docsis 3 cable modem quit linking on a regular basis, so I opted for this one from Linksys. It never fails, runs vpn connections perfectly, and is impressive. The unit is small but gets the job done. Seems to run cool and passes traffic with no errors or retransmission. As a side note, I am familiar with these products, and encourage my friends to buy their own cable modem. I end up helping a lot. This is my first look at this linksys device, but I would buy it again. I seems solid.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Blake

customer_reviews.title: Luxury Internet
customer_reviews.text: It is a very simple and powerful replacement for your standard cable modem. After I installed this and my ISP tech ran a connection test to it , he was beside himself. He said to me, and i quote, "dude, wth do you have hokked to that line?, i ran the packet traces in a row with 0% latency?! I told him the model and specs....its the width of the signal that makes such a difference.
customer_reviews.author: meljack159

customer_reviews.title: it's cool to the touch for me
customer_reviews.text: Don't know where people say it gets hot, it's cool to the touch for me. My old Cisco is the one that gets hot. It hasn't failed me yet. Highly recommend this product if you are not going over 100mbps. Have a nice day.
customer_reviews.author: zombiepitoflove

customer_reviews.title: Set up like a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: It has been a week since I installed this modem and no problems so far. I use Comcast/Xfinity internet and I am using a Linksys Router E1200 N300 as well. I first read about choices of modems on Comcast website and after buying this modem I logged in my Comcast account followed instructions and the set up was pretty easy. At the end of set up I saw my modem listed in my account as my modem.
customer_reviews.author: Talisman

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Fast and simple to hookup. Plugged it into my new apartment's coax, called Xfinity/Comcast, and got it working within minutes. Haven't had any issues of connection dropping, overheating, etc. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy, Modem not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This modem is not stable, it needs to be reset frequently. Called support and their solution was to not use a surge protector, which didn't work. Do not buy this product, huge waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Htur05

customer_reviews.title: Lynksys modem does the job!
customer_reviews.text: We just needed an updated modem. Cable company turned off signal to the previous modem over Christmas week. Forcing us to buy a new modem. This one is an updated version of the Linksys model we had previously. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: M.C.L

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Works great! If you are paying for high speed cable Internet you need the right cable modem and this is it! 300 down and 100 up and I get the full band width I am paying for using this modem.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Going strong after a year
customer_reviews.text: This has been great. It’s been over a year since I started using this and it’s still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: CHARLES F LUEDEMANN

customer_reviews.title: Buyer CAUTION
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE FOR XFINITY/COMCAST USE!! They flash their own firmware upon activation of modem which causes boot looping every few minutes. They will not roll back firmware for you. And Linksys can not help you with firmware either.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell C...

customer_reviews.title: Gerat modem!  Fast speeds
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that we finally bought our own modem instead of continuing to lease from our cable/ internet provider. It saves us money over time with no monthly rental fee, and also appears to be much stronger than the modem that they provided us with! We are now streaming media all over our house at the same time, with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is for only 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Amazon is of course amazing. Customer service is for linksys is by far the worst I have ever experienced. I have just spent 3 hours attempting to have our modem returned or fixed but to no avail. After 2 hours of them telling us it was user error, my husband who is tech savy explained that it is 100% the modem causing the problem. After being transferred 5 times, they said that the warranty we received after purchasing applies to other products but not to our product. I have NEVER written a negative review on a company but I have also never experienced such poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Trim

customer_reviews.title: Liked it, but couldn't use it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and small, arrived fast, easy to install, and great software. Only issue is that (b/c it is refurbished) Comcast insisted it was still activated on someone else's account, and wouldn't give me an inch. Too bad, had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: A very capable modem
customer_reviews.text: On a 200mbps xfinity connection with ASUS RT-AC68U Router; Download speed from speedtest increased from 187mbps to 240mbps after replacing the xfinity modem with this one. Upload increased from 10mpbs to 12mbps, I think xfinity is throttling my upload speed. A very capable modem.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't connect ever
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't connect at all. I bought another one that had no problem. I messed up and waited too long to ask to return it so it was just a waste of money. I had a professional attempt installation, no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It works great until the ISP sends an update and you have to reboot the cable modem from time to time. There is nothing wrong with the modem. I would buy again, if needed. I have never used Tech Support.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Linksys DOCSIS 3.0 16x4 Cable Modem (CM3016)
customer_reviews.text: I boght the Linksys DOCSIS 3.0 16x4 Cable Modem (CM3016) for my girlfriend. She had just upgraded her internet speed and told her that she had to upgrade her modem to a DOCSIS 3.0. Since I have one on my network, I suggested this model to her. She was amazed that she can now download 3+ programs at once. So far so good. Good job Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little modem, quick and easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: Really great little modem, very quick to setup. Far smaller than the giant hulking modem that Spectrum (Time Warner) was trying to rent to me--now I'm saving 10$/month by using this instead. Very happy with it, easy to set up following the instructions on TWC/Spectrum's website!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan K

customer_reviews.title: Good at first. Then not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first year and a half. Lately I won’t get the speeds I’m supposed to be getting and I’ll have to unplug the power and plug back in for it to sync itself back. Kind of annoying to do this every couple of weeks. Otherwise I live the size and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D'Ambrozio

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't hold a connection.
customer_reviews.text: It started out working fine but then after several months it started dropping internet connection with increasing frequency. By the time I decided to replace it, it was dropping the connection almost hourly, requiring a reset each time.
customer_reviews.author: sffone

customer_reviews.title: Don't rent modems
customer_reviews.text: Update Oct 2018: This little guy died on us after a little over one year. We had to buy another one. Not so happy with the quality.. Original review from Oct 2017 w/ 5 stars: We used it with Comcast in Illinios and now CableOne in Idaho. Works perfectly, easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Simple, straightforward. Worked right away with no issues. Comcast didn't even slightly object (that is new!!). The service I signed up for is 50 Mb/s, this handles that easily. Why would you pay more, or want more complication? Zero problems at 30 days in. buying experience was flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Greg E

customer_reviews.title: A must for streaming video
customer_reviews.text: The Modem was about the same raw downstream speed, but the muli-channel ability really shines when 3 high-def devices are viewing videos. i now get almost no buffering interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Fish

customer_reviews.title: Puma chip beware
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for alittle, constant dropping and intermittent connection issues. Got rid of the box so can't return. Replaced with a arris 8200 all is well now. Should have taken previou reviews serious. Now have a $130 dollar paper weight
customer_reviews.author: Nick G.

customer_reviews.title: Working great, good price!
customer_reviews.text: Have waited to review this until it's been installed/working for a good month. No problems or issues, worked great out of the box. My internet speed package is 300mb, and my speed tests were about 324mb - right on the mark. Have not had to reboot, power cycle or anything - rock solid so far. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Pony

customer_reviews.title: Performed much better than a more expensive model
customer_reviews.text: I use Cox Communications and pay for 300 Mbps. I bought this Linksys solely because I wanted to try the Linksys Velop router and I figured that it might work better with a Linksys product. I was not disappointed - I'm finally getting the speeds I am paying for. Highly recommend this cable modem. I would suggest staying away from the "combo" modem/routers - get this modem and a good router, the combo ones I have used (and they were much more expensive) are considerably slower.
customer_reviews.author: Super Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Solid modem
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great modem for us. We’ve had it for 3 years and never had any problem with it. We have had plenty of problems with Spectrum, but not with this modem. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: LINKSYS tech support was fantastic! They walked me through the complete setup
customer_reviews.text: Added a Linksys router with the Linksys modem, needed more speed for my RING doorbell and this did it! Changed internet service from ATT to NEWWAVE, because ATT WIFI speed was .49 MBPS and the RING needs over 1 MBPS or higher both download and upload speeds. LINKSYS tech support was fantastic! They walked me through the complete setup, which was rather confusing.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Buy the extended warranty!
customer_reviews.text: This modem is a big increase compared to Spectrum's modem. My problems with it however are a big annoyance. Several times a week it will freeze up and has to be reset. This is a problem when working from home. The modem has only been used for 4 months and has no return eligibility anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Kenton Hubner

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. takes minutes and works great. Better than paying 13 dollars a month to your internet provider for something that pays for itself in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Donald G. Poppleton

customer_reviews.title: Using with Google WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I am paying for 150 Mbps on Xfinity and have this modem connected to Google WiFi. Sometimes I get 179 Mbps, sometimes I get 5 Mbps. Not sure if it's the fault of the modem or the wireless router. Then again, it's shared bandwidth throughout my community so there's that. At least it hasn't deprived me of internet connection completely. *Knock on wood*
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Increase 50% more internet speed.
customer_reviews.text: Style: 960 Mbps (24x faster) I've linked to T-Mobile (AC-1900) By ASUS Wireless-AC1900 Dual-Band Gigabit Router and it is now 50% more speed through my wireless setup internet for home use. I have Cox internet for my service provider and was using my old ARRIS SURFboard SBG6580 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem/ Wi-Fi N300 2.4Ghz + N300 5GHz Dual Band Router and every hour will disconnect me from the internet access. Now with the new setup I have not been once disconnected. I would recommend this modem to friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Kenni

customer_reviews.title: Linksys works really good
customer_reviews.text: Really simple to setup!! Took longer for Comcast to to register the mac address than to do all of the setup! We have 2 TV's, computer, 2 Ipads, 2 cell phones, Xbox and a printer hooked up to the WiFi and they all run smooth as silk
customer_reviews.author: rar49

customer_reviews.title: Died in 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in October 2018. Stopped working entirely in August 2019. I've never had a durable modem. Do modem manufacturers do this on purpose? This thing is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: CAtoCHI

customer_reviews.title: Recently switched to Timewarner and the modem/router provided was crap. (Was only getting about 100 down) After some ...
customer_reviews.text: Recently switched to Timewarner and the modem/router provided was crap. (Was only getting about 100 down) After some research I ended up picking this one as all wanted was just a modem. I wanted to keep my Quantum Gateway Router as it was already configured. After setting up this new modem with my out router, I was getting over 400 down on a 300 plan.
customer_reviews.author: Anatole

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects/Reboots every 30 minuets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a Lightening Deal last year, and I was waiting for a good deal on a router... Long story short, I forgot I had this modem until I stumbled on a Prime Day deal for a router. Needless to say, now that I have both set up and running I can see why the 30 latest reviews are 1 star. The modem reboots itself every 30 min, and I sometimes have to unplug it and manually reboot it. Wish I could return, but it’s been too long since I purchased, even though I just opened. DO NOT BUY! Also, it’s ridiculous that it’s Amazon Prime’s #1 recommendation for Modems!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I had Atlantic BB install ISP service using this modem ...
customer_reviews.text: I had Atlantic BB install ISP service using this modem. I don't know if the firm ware was out of date or not present but I only had an internet service for one day (the first) and two 5-min intervals on two separate days during the first three weeks. I spent at least fifteen hours on hold waiting to speak to tech representatives (with AtlanticBB) during that period. I had to wait for10 days to get a AtlanticBB tech out to my house, and when he came up on my front porch the internet connected and hasn't stopped.???????
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy buy buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love how I'm rating the Wi-Fi signal on this device but this is a modem and not a router lol, there is no Wi-Fi signal. this device works as advertised I'm glad I was able to get it for $34.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: My last modem still worked after 12 years. The ...
customer_reviews.text: My last modem still worked after 12 years . The speed was maxed out at 20 mbps . Service Electric Cable had no compatible list of brands . If you bought your own it should be DOCIS 3.0, or 3.1 . with 24x8 channels . If you have Service Electric call them, they needed the Mac and serial number, said it would take an hour to update and load in their system, and it did . It's been working without a hiccup for 10 days .
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Simple enough, called Xfinity to add mac to my account, hooked up the signal and my wifi router and it works great. Does not emit wifi itself, must use external wifi router
customer_reviews.author: davis.g105

customer_reviews.title: Works.  Now I just need a new router
customer_reviews.text: No issues, it parses my data as expected or better than. Thanks. Using for 5 months without incident. Device does NOT get unusually hot as I read in other reviews. 2019/03/28 Been using this device for about 10 months now with no issues works great!
customer_reviews.author: Sleek Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Failed at less than 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked fine for just less than 10 months. I can't find out if I can return it. What is the warrantee?
customer_reviews.author: Pyrite921

customer_reviews.title: High Speed in Small Spaces
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. It you order this modem for Xfinity Comcast be sure you already have a good internet plan with them. Otherwise find another modem with a wifi router already within it. If it had not been those things this would have been a bad purchase for me. However, it was not and it saves me the rental fee from Xfinity each month. It also takes up less space.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnee

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, useful, solid little unit.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. You don't need hundreds of Mb throughput with typical cable internet packages. This cheap little modem set up quickly, was recognized by Infinity and hasn't died yet... Knock on wood.
customer_reviews.author: om german

customer_reviews.title: Very slow
customer_reviews.text: We get the worst connection with this. Our WiFi is the same speed and impossible. We can’t have our phones on the WiFi and stream Netflix, which used to not be a problem and again our service did not change.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a month or so now and have had no issues. The man from the internet provider said it's one of the newer ones and praised its quality.
customer_reviews.author: hydetoday

customer_reviews.title: It's served me well. I used this to replace ...
customer_reviews.text: It's served me well. I used this to replace the ISP provided model and it's faster and more stylish. It's not even breaking a sweat running my 110Mbps connection.
customer_reviews.author: Demetri

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: Worked right away, and super fast. My Internet speeds are 300 down and 30 up, and this has no problem handling it with high traffic on multiple computers.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis2260

customer_reviews.title: Modem has worked w/o any problem since purchase and install
customer_reviews.text: I cut the cord with my Cable company and needed a modem for use with their Internet service -- to which I am captive since Fairfax County VA has a sole source contract with them for at least the past 17 years!
customer_reviews.author: Herbert B. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Throughput
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded modem to Linksys CM3024. Easy to install but did have to call network provider to activate the modem on the network. Works as advertised, although could have purchased it for $20 less at Sam's Club.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this modem
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this modem, it works better than the one Spectrum gave me, super fast responsive internet and saving$$$$$$$, and no overheating issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: dsaxophone

customer_reviews.title: It works great. Easy to setup and stay on line
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Easy to setup and stay on line. It is very easy setup the wireless router. The only draw back is it only one port to hookup the one router! Outstanding performance.
customer_reviews.author: LEROY WHITE

customer_reviews.title: Great little modem
customer_reviews.text: So far this modem has worked exactly as advertised. Its tiny footprint allows me to have it in our living room without taking away from the aesthetics of the room. Very satisfied after 30 days; hopefully it will be reliable.
customer_reviews.author: MrsManders

customer_reviews.title: Great modem for high speed internet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I updated my home internet package/speed from 50 Mbps to 150Mbps. I purchased this modem (and Linksys AC1900 Max Stream router). Very satisfied with results. Easy set up, internet speeds are much faster, no issues. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce D

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: Took seconds to install, called provider and was able able to setup modem in less than 5 minutes. It has not dropped and no more slow speeds. This modem works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Fast, high-quality and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for my new wifi home network upgrade. I wanted higher speed from my provider and didn't want to pay a monthly rental, so this was a great purchase. Inexpensive, and easy to set-up. No problems at all and works with my provider perfectly. Fast!
customer_reviews.author: erudy

customer_reviews.title: Great modem. Setup wasn't necessarily the easiest
customer_reviews.text: Great modem. Setup wasn't necessarily the easiest, but that wasn't due to the modem and due to being bounced around by the internet provider to get things set up. No issues with this whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: JTCanon

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: The modem worked great for about 4 months. Now it’s constantly dropping the connection. Now once or twice a day I have to unplug it in order to get it to reconnect. I’ve never had such a horrible experience with a modem. Stay away from this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Danielson

product_meta.title: Linksys (CM3016) Docsis 3.0 16x4 Cable Modem
product_meta.description: Style:686 Mbps (16x faster)Maximize speed, increase savings. Certified by all major cable providers, Linksys 16x4 cable modem (CM3016) delivers maximum Wi Fi speeds from existing Internet providers up to 250 Mbps.† Save up to $120 a year by eliminating monthly modem rental fees, finally giving the Wi Fi speed you deserve. Stable, high speed connectivity for media streaming and online gaming from 16 download and 4 upload channels. Intel Puma 6 chipset achieves high speed downstream and upstream performance. Easy plug and play setup.
feature_bullets: Compatible with Comcast Xfinity, Time Warner Cable, Charter, Cox, Cablevision, and more. Requires Cable Internet Service
Not compatible with: Verizon, AT&T, or CenturyLink
Experience high speed Wi Fi speeds from your existing ISP plans upto 250 Mbps. Ideal for HD media streaming, simultaneous online gaming, web surfing and more
Features Intel Puma 6 chipset to achieve high speed downstream and upstream performance
Able to handle high bandwidth transfer rates over your existing cable lines

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars956 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
